text: shin-okubo Tokyo where thousands of
ethnic Koreans live last month activists
started using Google Maps to spot the
exact location of racist graffiti in
this neighborhood most of it was aimed
at Korean people saying Koreans go home
and/or go back to where you came from or
you know Koreans are trash or they're
cockroaches things like that activists
found 53 pieces of racist graffiti so
far we wanted to show how prevalent it
was nationalist groups have marched
through these streets they clashed with
anti-racist campaigners because of
recent changes in the atmosphere has
become very difficult for people like me
a lot of people have even abandoned
their Korean names the number of
immigrants in Japan is quite small and
Koreans form one of the largest groups
in that minority ethnic koreans don't
feel a part of Japanese society they're
not allowed to vote even at local level
doing an activity like this with Google
Maps was a way to get involved with the
local community activists in Tokyo say
they've received reports of racist
graffiti in a number of other Japanese
cities
you
